Om Birla.description: NEW DELHI: The new Lok Sabha Speaker, Om Birla, a two-time BJP MP from Rajasthan, is a relative newcomer for the post traditionally held by seniors.   A surprise pick by the ruling BJP-led NDA   , Birla's name was proposed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi himself for the post, sources said. The 56-year-old leader is considered to be close to both Modi and Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) president Amit Shah. Birla's nomination for the Lok Sabha Speaker's post also has the   backing of non-NDA parties   such as the YSR Congress Party (YSRCP) and the Biju Janata Dal (BJD). Starting his political journey as a student leader, Birla was also elected to the Rajasthan Assembly for three consecutive terms in 2003, 2008 and 2013. He won his first Lok Sabha election in 2014 and was again elected this year from Rajasthan's Kota-Bundi seat. Birla defeated Congress's Ramnarayan Meena with a margin of over 2.5 lakh votes in the recently-concluded general election. A conscientious parliamentarian, Birla has registered an 86-per cent average attendance in the House, asked 671 questions, participated in 163 debates and introduced six private members' bills in the 16th Lok Sabha. From 1991 to 2003, he was a key leader in the Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) as a state-level president first and then, as a vice-president at the national level. Birla, who holds a Masters degree in commerce, is a member of the Standing Committee on Energy in Parliament, the Committee on Petitions and the Consultative Committee for the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment. He succeeds eight-time MP Sumitra Mahajan as the Lok Sabha Speaker, a post traditionally held by senior MPs. However, this is not the first time that a relative newcomer has occupied the position. In 1996, Telugu Desam Party (TDP) leader G M C Balayogi, also a two-time MP then, was elected as the Speaker in the Lower House of Parliament. After his death in a helicopter crash in 2002, Shiv Sena leader and first-time MP Manohar Joshi was appointed to the position. Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Beware of unscrupulous agents: Canada to.description: BATHINDA: Ahead of commencement of admission to campuses in Canada that attract a large number of Indian students, the Canadian government on Monday came out with public notices cautioning those applying for visa not to waste money. Through a public notice, the Canadian government announced that it costs only about Rs 5,200 (100 Canadian dollars) to apply for a visa to Canada, while some immigration agents charge a lot more than that. It advised that visa should be applied only through proper channel by visiting the official government of Canada website. Thousands of students every year apply for visa by paying hefty fees. Apart from them, thousands of Indians, especially Punjabis, apply for the Canada visa. According to industry sources, nearly 75,000 students had got visas for Canada in 2017 and this figure is on the rise. According to a rough estimate, over one lakh students are expected to go to Canada in 2019. Immigrating to Canada has been a craze among Punjabis. Earlier it used to be Doaba region in Punjab that lead in immigration to Canada and many other western countries, but now Malwa region is catching up fast with the mushrooming of IELTS (International English Language Testing System) centres in every small and big town. “As a lot of aspirants are duped in the name of Canada visa, such stories reach the Canadian government too and that is why the government decided to come out with public notices in most of the newspaper published from Punjab. Most of the cases of duping take place in the state only,” said an immigration consultant preferring anonymity. Bathinda is also emerging as a big centre for immigration to Canada and other western countries. Another immigration consultant said that over 5,000 students apply for Canada from Bathinda region every year. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Cotton plants damaged in high velocity w.description: BATHINDA: High velocity wind and hailstorm which lashed the region late on Wednesday evening damaged the cotton crop in Bathinda and Mansa districts of Punjab. Apart from inclement weather, a 60-feet-wide breach in a drain at Chak Attar Singh Wala village in Bathinda too affected the cotton crop as the fields were submerged in drain water. The cotton plants got damaged in over a dozen villages in both the cotton-producing districts due to hailstorm in Budhlada, Talwandi Sabo, Maur and Sangat areas. The agriculture department has sent the teams to the affected areas. The Bathinda deputy commissioner, B Srinivasan also visited the villages where cotton crop was affected due to hailstorm. With breach in Teona drain near Chak Attar Singh Wala village late on Wednesday night, crops in nearly 400 acres were submerged — the area was planted mostly with cotton but paddy nursery too had been transplanted in some of the area. Farmers Gurdial Singh of Sangat village and Prem Singh of Talwandi Sabo said the hailstorm caused a huge loss to cotton crop. “I had sown cotton in three acres and the plants have been damaged in the hailstorm,” Prem Singh said. “Although leaves of cotton plants have been damaged due to the hailstorm, new leaves are expected to flourish as yet the crop was in the early stages. However, we are keeping vigil and teams have been sent to fields to assess the loss and suggest corrective measures to the farmers,” Bathinda chief agriculture officer Guraditta Singh said. “I have visited the affected villages to assess the loss. Though loss is there, it is not severe and I have asked the agriculture department to prepare report of loss which I will send to the state government,” Bathinda DC B Srinivasan said. Medial fraternity justifies having priva.description: AMRITSAR: Following attack on two junior doctors in Kolkata, the medical fraternity in the holy city is mulling over hiring their own private security including bouncers besides they have demanded from government to form stringent laws to punish the wayward mob attacking at hospitals even as Indian Medical Association (IMA) has announced a nationwide strike on Monday to express solidarity with the victim doctors. “We are already working under constant fear and this recent incident has only aggravated our anxiety, government has to come up with stringent laws so that exemplary punishments are given to the persons attacking doctors and ransacking hospitals" said Dr Hartej Singh Nagpal who runs a 100 beded Hartej Hospital while talking to TOI on Sunday. He said Kolkata incident had forced him to rethink over his hospital’s security. “Presently we have just around half a dozen unarmed guards but now I am thinking to hire private security" said he adding that Nursing Homes cell of IMA, Amritsar was holding a meeting on Wednesday to discuss the issue in detail. Director, Cardiology, Fortis hospital Dr Arun Chopra observed that the violence against doctors was on rise especially in past couple of years. He said they had around 35 to 40 unarmed security personals out of which only about 12 to 15 were present in the hospital at any given time. “But they are insufficient to handle a frenzied mob of even fifty persons” he said. The Kolkata incident had rejuvenated their worst fears about their own and their family’s security, he added. He also agreed that if government failed to provide security cover to doctors they would be left with no option but to hire their own private security. The Times of India on Sunday visited a few private hospitals to find private security guards deployed at various places in plain clothes, even a few posing as patients, doctors practising with their licensed weapons. Doctors were collectively of view that poor infrastructure in government hospitals often forces patients to rush to private hospitals and many of them were not able to bear the high cost of treatment and in case of patient’s death of a patient, the kins didn’t wish to pay the pending bills and start blaming doctors for their negligence. “Often these kind of people are sheltered by some local politicians who instigate them to stage dharna against the hospital and mount pressure on the hospital management to waive off their remaining bill” said a doctor who didn’t wish to give his name. Managing director Medicity, Dr Avtar Singh observed that private hospitals were in unorganised sector so they were vulnerable to violence. “When I started my hospital, I was advised to have security in the hospital but I denied but now I realise that I need security" said he adding that even the aggression in the society had increased over the years. Avtar who has his own private security said that the guards not only regulate the traffic of patients but also keep an eye on the behavioural pattern of relatives of a patient and warns the hospital staff accordingly. While justifying having bouncers by the doctors, he opined that first and the foremost reason behind attack on doctors and hospital was payment of bills. "When it comes on paying the bill, they get hold of a local politician who instigate them for dharna etc. this has happened with us at Medicity about six months ago” said he while suggesting that government had to make stringent of the rules and declare violence against doctors as a non bailable. Meanwhile president IMA, Amritsar Dr Inderbir Singh Nizzar informed that a complete shout down would be observed on Monday. “There will be no OPD or elective surgeries but emergency services will continue”, he said. He informed that IMA had written to Prime Minister Narendra Modi suggesting that a multifaceted approach encompassing the areas of legislation, security, data collection, training and public awareness was required to successfully address the issue of violence on health sector. Punjab: Sales tax inspector nabbed accep.description: BATHINDA: State vigilance bureau on Thursday nabbed sales tax inspector from Kotkapura in Faridkot district while accepting illegal gratification of Rs 25,000. Vigilance Bureau officials said sales tax inspector Jaspal Handa was nabbed while accepting bribe of Rs 25,000 from Ankur Garg of Faridkot. Ankur, who worked as scrap dealer, had approached the VB to exempt from tax penalty and said the sales inspector demanded Rs 50,000 from him to exempt his firm from tax penalty and the deal was struck at Rs 25,000. After verifying his information, the VB team laid trap and inspector was arrested on the spot while accepting bribe in the presence of two official witnesses. Case under prevention of corruption act has been registered against the inspector at VB police station Bathinda and further investigations are being made. Uttar Pradesh.description: "You're sitting on my grand mother's grave," Salim Shah told this correspondent. She has been buried, he said, in his living room. A clutch of houses in Chah Pokhar in Achnera block of Agra have turned into graveyards as families are forced to bury their departed in their homes due to lack of a burial ground. As a result, the dead here are a constant part of day-to-day life. TOI found women cooking next to where their children were buried while the elderly rested on cots in a backyard full of graves. In one of the houses, Rinki Begum told TOI that five bodies were buried in her backyard, including that of her 10-month-old son who had died of an untreated fever. Another resident, Guddi, said, "For poor people like us, there is no dignity in death. Due to lack of space in houses, people have to sit and walk over graves. It is so disrespectful." Almost all the houses in the block have graves within the compound Most of the Muslim families here are poor and landless and men scout for work as contract labourers. They said their demand for a graveyard has been ignored for years. The pond in Chah Pokhar village, where a piece of land is allocated for the burial ground on papersThe apathy of the administration can be gauged from the fact that a plot allotted for a graveyard some years ago falls right in the middle of a pond. Repeated complaints have fallen on deaf ears and residents are running out of space. The fresh graves are no more cemented to ensure they occupy less space and stones of different sizes kept over them are the only way to tell them apart. Protests have erupted in the past over the issue. In 2017, after the death of resident Mangal Khan, his family refused to bury his body until land for a graveyard was provided in the village. After assurances by the authorities, they buried Khan near the pond. But the promises came to nothing. Living with the dead: A grave in the backyard"All we are asking for is some land for our ancestors. There is a cremation ground for the Hindus in the periphery of the village, but we are living with our dead," said Munim Khan, a factory worker. Desperate residents even tried reaching out to nearby Sanan village and Achnera town that have burial grounds. But they were not willing to part with precious space. "These two villages have a larger Muslim population than Chah Pokhar. Their burial grounds are filled to capacity," said Nizam Khan, a mechanic. Village pradhan Sundar Kumar said that he had asked officials several times for a burial ground for Muslim families, but no action was taken. Ravi Kumar NG, the district magistrate, said that he was not aware of the issue. "I will send an official team to the village and get details of the burial land required." Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\u2018No failure\u2019: NDRF says not tr.description: BATHINDA: An official of the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) said on Tuesday that they lacked expertise in retrieving babies stuck in borewells, so the five-day operation to retrieve two-year-old Fatehveer Singh from a 125-foot-deep borewell in Sangrur could not be called a failure. The NDRF is the premier body for rescue and relief operations in case of calamities, manmade and nature, in the country. NDRF 7th Battalion commandant Ravi Kumar told TOI on Tuesday that the operation to retrieve Fatehveer, who died after being rescued from borewell after five days, could not termed a “failed operation”. “Though NDRF does not have much expertise in handling such situations (of retrieving a baby from a borewell), we did our best. Central agencies do not leave anything to chance and we too made sincere efforts, though without success. We don’t blame anybody or ourselves; it is only the circumstances which came in the way of the operation,” he said. The operation to rescue Fatehveer has been criticized over the direction of a parallel pit, which was dug to pull out the boy, changing. Before this, the NDRF’s 7th Batallion, which is headquartered in Bathinda, had faced only one incident in which a child had fallen in a borewell. Kumar said the NDRF would analyse the shortcomings of the operation, if any, to find out how standard operating procedure for such situations could be improved. Kumar refuted allegations that the NDRF team did not even have a compass to know the exact direction for digging the parallel put. He said the team was “fully-equipped and compasses were present even in mobile phones”. Two assistant commandants of NDRF supervised the operation running over 5 days, with a team of 25 jawans. Kumar said that NDRF got information about the incident in the evening of June 6 and the team had reached Bhagwanpura village near Sunam by 7pm. He said the operation was “very tricky”. “Our assistant commandant Ajay Verma remained concentrated on the operation for four days and only then we sent the other team led by another assistant commandant, Om Parkash Bishnoi, to provide some rest to the first team,” the commandant added. “Earlier, our men tried to pull the boy by a rope. But, when all such efforts did not bear fruit, we decided to dig a parallel bore with the full consent of district administration, family and those present,” he added. The commandant said the direction of the second bore changed as the soil was sandy. He, however, dismissed rumours that the NDRF was not given full freedom and Dera Sacha Sauda volunteers and villagers obstructed them. Kumar fell back on the adage “prevention is better than cure”. “We need to take care that unmanned borewells are plugged to avoid another such incident,” he said. ‘Borewell narrower where kid was stuck’Assistant commandant Ajay Verma, who commanded the operation for four days, said the borewell had a nine-inch diameter at the mouth, but it narrowed down to six inches where the bot was stuck. “He was entangled so badly that only his hands were visible. On the very first day, we tried to pull him out with a rope, but there was no vacuum to hold him. We tried to pull him from hands, but that was unsuccessful too. The parallel pit was dug to extract from the other side, but that too not worked well either and only created vacuum to pull him from the main bore,” he said. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. 4-year-boy from Kathua falls into 20 fee.description: PATHANKOT: Panic hit Pathankot administration after reports of a four-year-old boy getting trapped in a borewell spread on Friday. However, the deputy commissioner later clarified that the incident occured in Kathua district of Jammu and Kashmir. The boy was immediately rescued by his family members and rushed to a private hospital in Pathankot for treatment, he said. However, earlier in the day, there was a scare in the Pathankot administration after reports of a four-year-old boy Pardeep falling into a borewell in the district were flashed in a section of media. Clearing the dust, Pathankot deputy commissioner Ramvir said the boy had fallen into a 20-feet deep well while playing and broke his leg. He was later shifted to a hospital in Pathankot for medical treatment. Pardeep is a resident of Gandial village in Kathua district, but on Pathankot border. It has a twin village Kirian, which lies in Pathankot district. In local parlance, the two villages are referred to as Kirian-Gandial, which caused the confusion and led to scare in Pathankot while Kathua administration remained unaware of it. “We have confirmed that the boy belongs to Kathua district and fractured his leg following a fall in a pit while playing. He was admitted in a private hospital in Pathankot and is under treatment. We are taking care of him,” said Ramvir, adding that Pathankot administration had already got all the borewells sealed. He said the boy was recovering and would be discharged from hospital by evening. When contacted, deputy commissioner Kathua Vikas Kundal expressed ignorance about the incident. “I have just talked to the SP, but he denies any such incident took place,” he said. Notably, a three-year old Fatehveer Singh, a resident of Bhagwanpur village in Sangrur, had fallen into a 150-feet deep and seven inch wide borewell on June 6. He died in the borewell as rescuers failed to reach him. His body was brought out after 110 hours on June 11. Following the incident, Punjab government had directed all the deputy commissioners of state to ensure that no borewell is left open. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Woman dragged, punched, kicked; Congress.description: BATHINDA: Police on Friday booked a Congress councillor of Muktsar municipal council, arrested his brother and five of his associates after a video went viral in which a group of well-built men are seen dragging a woman out of her house and brutally assaulting her with punches, kicks and a leather belt. Muktsar SSP Manjit Singh Dhesi said they were on the lookout for the concillor and he had been charged with criminal conspiracy, though he was not present on the spot when the incident took place. In the video, the men do not soften the assault even when the woman’s five-year-old son is heard crying. Near the end of the video, the men are also seen brutally assaulting the woman’s elderly mother when she comes to save her. SSP Dhesi said Meena Rani, the woman was assaulted, had informed them that she owed Rs 23,000 to Congress councillor Rakesh Chaudhary's brother, Suresh Chaudhary. As she could not pay the money on time, the accused got her beaten up. Rani has been admitted to Muktsar civil hospital and is stated to be out of danger, though brusied and with abrasions. Though TOI spoke to Meena’s mother, it could not ascertain her name. The woman told TOI that Suresh Chaudhary demanded Rs 23,000 from them on Friday, but they did not have any money and sought five days to repay it and even promised to pay him interest. “But he did not listen to us and threatened us with dire consequences if the money was not returned immediately. About 11am, he came along some accomplices and barged into our home. He dragged my daughter out of the house and started beating her up. They also abused her and did not spare me when I went to save her,” she said. She said their entire family was of labourers. “We would not have taken the loan from them if we would have known they were so ruthless,” she said. SSP Dhesi said Suresh Chaudhary and his accomplices Roop Lal, Sunny Chaudhary, Guddi, Sekhu and Jebo had been charged with sections 307 (attempt to murder), 452 (house trespass), 354(assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty), 354B (assault or use of criminal force to woman with intent to disrobe) and 120B (criminal conspiracy) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC). “Efforts are being made to arrest others involved in the incident, including the councillor,” he said. Chaudhary was with Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) at first. He contested the last MC polls as an independent and won. He later on joined the Congress. Pakistan\u2019s pro-Khalistanis support.description: AMRITSAR: Pakistan’s ISI-backed Sikh face Gopal Singh Chawla used the Operation Bluestar anniversary as an occasion to openly link Kashmir and Khalistan issues. He and some other pro-Khalistan Sikh leaders of Pakistan on Thursday also took up the issue of freeing Kashmir at Nankana Sahib on Thursday. A video of Chawla also appeard on social media in which he can be heard saying that Sikhs would also struggle for the freedom of Kashmir. “We will snatch away our Kashmir and Khalistan,” he announces. However, the move has upset some other Sikhs in the neighbouring country. A moderate Sikh leader from Pakistan, who didn’t wish to give his name, said, “We have never heard political leaders of Pakistan or of Islamic militant organizations raising their voice in support of Uighur Muslims in China because of the country’s economic interest. Now, Sikh radicals here have also started taking up the issue of so called persecution of Muslims in Kashmir and they also don’t talk about Uighur.” Quoting saveuighur website he said, “Right now more than two million Uighur Muslims are in Chinese concentration camps. Men are taken to the camps, their children to orphanages and women are forced to live with Chinese men.” At Nankana Sahib, pro-Khalsitan Sikhs also displayed posters of secessionist ‘Referendum 2020’ on the main gate of Gurdwara Nankana Sahib. Wearing T shirt with picture of militant leader Jarnail Singh Bhinderanwala, Chawla is seen accompanied by a handful of turban wearing Sikh youth and Muslims. He raised slogans in praise of Sikh militant organizations Babbar Khalsa, Khalistan Commando Force and Pakistan government. Known to be ISI’s Sikh voice against India, Chawla, who is also a member of the Evacuee Trust Property Board, used expletives on camera against then Indian Prime Minister Indira Gandhi who had ordered Operation Bluestar. Similarly another Indian Sikh fugitive Gajinder Singh of Dal Khasla, who is believed to be hiding in Pakistan, uploaded a message on the occasion of Eid on his Facebook page with “special greeting for Muslims of Kashmir”. Nestle India conducts cleanliness drives.description: MOGA: On the World Oceans Day on Saturday, Nestle volunteers participated in clean-up drives worldwide. In India, around 2,000 volunteers participated in this initiative which took place in towns near Nestle India factories and branch locations. The volunteers included Nestle India employees and their families, NGO partners, distribution partners, suppliers and officials. The volunteers at Moga also participated in the clean-up drive near the factory pledging their commitment to a plastic waste-free environment. Commenting on this initiative, Nestle India chairman and managing director Suresh Narayanan said, "World Oceans Day provides a unique opportunity to honour, help protect and conserve our natural resources. On a personal level, I have taken a pledge to reduce plastic waste in my office, home and wherever we as an organisation can make a difference. Occasions like these enable us to educate and drive behavioral change across the organisation as well as the people associated with it.” At the clean-up drive, the volunteers were divided into different teams to ensure systematic collection of waste. At the end of the drive, the collected waste was sent to the processing facilities and disposed responsibly. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

SGPC meets today to tally articles of Si.description: AMRITSAR: The Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) has convened a special meeting on Thursday to discuss the articles of Sikh Reference Library (SRL) in possession of the Sikh body before and after Operation Bluestar. The meeting has been called after former senior SAD leader Manjit Singh G K alleged that some rare articles of SRL had been sold in the international market, including the swaroop of Sri Guru Granth Sahib bearing the signature of the 10th Sikh master, Guru Gobind Singh. “This is an official meeting being convened to relook into the articles of SRL in possession with SGPC, pre- and post-Operation Bluestar,” said SGPC chief secretary Roop Singh on Wednesday. In recent past, G K — a former president of Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee — demanded a white paper on SRL. G K had alleged that the swaroop was sold for Rs 12 crore in the international market. He had also claimed that the Army had handed over all articles taken away from the Golden Temple to the CBI, which wanted to prove Akali leader Jarnail Singh’s links with foreign agencies in court. But, when it didn’t find anything seditious in the articles, the CBI was forced to return the same to SGPC on court’s orders. Rubbishing the allegations levelled by G K, Roop Singh said, “If SGPC had got the articles back, then why has its leadership been continuously approaching the Centre and Army for their retrieval since 1984.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. 4-year-old Kathua boy falls into 20ft we.description: PATHANKOT: The district administration fell into a panic after report of a four-year-old boy falling into a borewell in Pathankot was flashed in a section of media on Friday morning. However, deputy commissioner Pathankot, Ramvir denied the report saying the boy named Pardeep was not from Pathankot, but from the neighbouring Kathua district of Jammu and Kashmir. The boy had fallen in a small pit while playing and broke his leg and was later shifted to Pathankot for medical treatment. Pardeep lives with his uncle Bittu Kumar, a resident of Kirian Gandial village in Kathua district. “We have confirmed that the boy belongs to Kathua district whose leg was fractured after falling in a pit while playing. He was admitted to a private hospital in Pathankot and is under treatment. We are taking care of him,” said Ramvir, adding that Pathankot administration had already got all the borewells sealed. He said the boy was recovering and would be discharged from hospital by evening. Earlier, there were reports that a Pathankot boy had fallen in a borewell but was immediately rescued by his family members. Kidian and Gandyal villages are spread across Pathankot and Kathua districts of Punjab and Jammu and Kashmir. Notably, a two years old boy, Fatehveer Singh, resident of Bhagwanpur village in Sangrur, had fallen into a 150-feet-deep and seven inches wide borewell on June 6 and was brought out dead after 110 hours on June 11. Following the incident, Punjab government had directed all the deputy commissioners of state to ensure that no borewell was left open. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Two-year-old drowns in village pond.description: ABOHAR: A two-year-old boy playing with his elder brother outside his home was found dead in a village pond nearby on Tuesday evening. His body was found stuck in mud at the bottom of pond, which has no guard walls, by some youth looking for him. According to information, Harman, son of Gurprit Singh, was playing with his elder brother at Dharmpura village when he disappeared and the village launched a hunt for him. When he could not be found, a villager suggested that they look for him in the pond. when the water was drained out, Harman's body was found stuck at the bottom.  Expressing grief over the tragic incident, village sarpanch Sumitra Devi said the panchayat has decided to build a boundary wall around the pond to prevent any such incident in the future. Kathua gang rape: No trial yet for eight.description: PATHANKOT: Of the eight accused in the Kathua gang rape and murder case, seven faced trial and six were convicted on Monday. The eighth accused, who claimed to be a juvenile, is yet to be put on trial as the matter regarding determination of his age is pending before the Jammu and Kashmir high court. He is currently lodged in a juvenile home in Jammu and Kashmir’s Ranbir Singh Pura area. He is alleged to have raped, strangulated and bludgeoned the eight-yearold with a stone, in the J&K crime branch charge sheet. His trial would begin only after his age is determined by the court. Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Spooked by Kolkata, private hospitals in.description: AMRITSAR: Private medical practitioners in Amritsar on Monday decided to hire their own security in the wake of a mob attacking two doctors at a hospital in Kolkata on June 10. Indian Medial Association (IMA) Amritsar president Dr Inderbir Singh Nizzar said police, in the past, had not extended help to doctors when needed. “So we have decided to hire private security for protection,” Nizzar said. On a shutdown call given by the IMA to express solidarity with the Kolkata doctors, private practitioners here suspended outdoor patient departments and operations. However, emergency services remained unaffected Nizzar informed that Dr S J S Randhawa of Randhawa Hospital had been assigned the task to chalk out modalities and coordinate for hiring security teams. “We have also decided to sensitize district police,civil administration, politicians and general public about the medical profession and dispel false notions against doctors through mass-awareness drives,” he said. Dr Hartej Singh Nagpal of Hartej Hospital said rge purpose of hiring personal security was not to frighten anybody, but to save doctors, their hospitals, nursing homes, staff and family members from personal harm. In a meeting of IMA on Monday, the doctors observed that the state had failed miserably to protect doctors and was indifferent to their plight, and this forced them to think of hiring personal security. Expressing hope from new Union health minister Dr Harsh Wardhan to help medical fraternity, Dr Avtar Singh of Medicity said, “I am of the view that being a doctor himself, the new health minister can bring some changes for the security of doctors, who are often subjected to violence. All we need is a strict law,” he added. Fortis Hospital cardiology director Dr Arun Chopra said despite the strike call, all emergency cases were attended to. “The strike is a symbolic gesture to get the government’s attention towards the safety of doctors,” he said. Punjab seeks to promote drip irrigation.description: BATHINDA: With water-guzzling paddy transplantation already begun, the Punjab government is thinking up ways to take control of the fast depleting underground water table. One such measures at sustainable water management is its latest attempt at promoting drip irrigation in maize crop. The state agriculture and farmer welfare department has fixed a target for sowing maize: 1.50 lakh hectare. A pilot project of micro irrigation on maize crop will be taken up in 1,000 acre this season under state government’s ambitious project Tandrust Punjab. Maize sowing had been on decline in Punjab over the years. The reason why the state government has fixed a target to increase acreage under maize in Punjab. In 2012-13 and 2013-14, the maize was sown in 1.31 lakh hectare, in 2014-15 it was 1.26 lakh hectare, in 2015-16 1.27 lakh, in 2016-17 1.16 lakh and in 2017-18 the maize was sown in 1.14 lakh hectare with production of 4.10 lakh metric tonne. This season’s production target stands at 5.70 lakh tonne. Mission director of Tandrust Punjab, KS Pannu, who is also secretary Punjab agriculture, said, “Out of 1,000 acre of maize under drip irrigation, 900 acre will be on surface drip system and 100 acre will be sub-surface drip system. Four micro irrigation companies will demonstrate drip irrigation on an area of 10 acre each to show farmers how water can be conserved through drip irrigation and also to prevail them upon to adopt the drip irrigation system.” Pannu said that department officials have been directed to promote alternative methods of crop watering in the wake of serious water resource challenge the state is likely to face in the coming years. According to soil conservation officials, drip irrigation not only conserves water but it also increases yield. Experts from Punjab Agricultural University said that they have successfully conducted experiments of sub-surface drip irrigation system on maize, wheat and moong and that it should be promoted on mass scale. It is to be mentioned here that a pilot campaign of micro irrigation on cotton was also undertaken this season by soil conservation department, under which 200 acre of cotton crop has been brought under drip irrigation. Man kills wife, injures brother and pare.description: BATHINDA: A 24-year-old man allegedly killed his wife and injured three of his family members on Tuesday night as he suspected his wife of being in an illicit relationship with his younger brother. Police said Hardeep Singh, the accused, along with his half a dozen accomplices, killed his wife Rajvir Kaur in a fit of rage and seriously injured his brother Arshdeep, mother Charanjit Kaur and father Jaskaran Singh in their house at Raike Khurd village in Bathinda. All four were taken to Bathinda civil hospital around midnight by neighbours where Rajvir Kaur was declared brought dead. Hardeep and Rajvir, who hailed from Muktsar, had tied the nuptial knot only three months ago. In her statement to the police, Charanjit said nearly 15 days ago, Hardeep had left home and returned on Tuesday night with five-six unknown persons. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rape survivor claims her father had sold.description: BATHINDA: The case of gang rape of a 19-year-old girl of Bathinda took a curious turn on Thursday when the rape survivor revealed that her own father had sold her to two women, who further handed her over to some persons. The revelation was made by the girl before a member of National Commission for Women (NCW), who visited the rape survivor for personal hearing. The victim told the NCW member that her father had sold her to two women who handed her over to some persons who kept on raping her for over two months. It was after sexual exploitation for over two months that the girl had returned home, filed a complaint and the rape case was registered. The rape survivor, her mother and maternal grandfather on the evening of June 3 had appeared before Union minister Harsimrat Kaur Badal, who held a hurriedly convened press conference along with them. But then neither the girl nor the family members had spoken about her father selling her, instead they had accused the police and some Congress leaders of harassing them. Now, after the truth coming to fore, the name of rape victim’s father has been added to the case and he has been arrested. However, NCW member Shayamala S Kundar accused the police of mishandling the case and remaining insensitive towards the plight of a harried girl and her family. She has directed the Bathinda SSP to seek explanation from the police officials involved in the case and provide report in two days. She also asked the SSP to provide report to the NCW on a weekly basis and arrest all the guilty in the case. Taking on the Congress leaders, Harsimrat Badal on Tuesday night had tweeted, “Spoke to NCW chairperson Rekha Sharma. She will be visiting Bathinda to give personal hearing to gang rape victim girl whom police have been harassing for past 2 months at behest of Congress bosses. I reiterate that I won’t sit back until culprits are put behind bars.” Kundar said, “I visited the rape survivor at her residence where she said that her father had sold her to two women Amarjit Kaur and Rani, who took her away. Her mother had filed a missing complaint at Kotwali police station on January 19, 2019. The women handed her over to some persons who kept on raping her for over two months and she somehow came back to Bathinda on March 23 and filed the FIR.” She said that she found that police did not sensitively investigate the matter and did not take the missing complaint as seriously as it should have. “They should have traced the girl. The FIR was also registered only after medical examination was conducted, and proper treatment was not provided as the girl even today feels the pain. I have recommended proper treatment and also held discussions with the district legal authorities and have asked them to prepare a case for financial assistance to the rape survivor.” Bathinda SSP Nanak Singh, who accompanied the NCW member, said that as per the statement recorded by the rape survivor, her father has been included in the case and arrested. “Apart from him, main accused in the case Azad, and three others Amarjit Kaur, Rani and Deepak have also been arrested,” he said. Harsimrat Kasur Badal was not available for comments. Twist in Tale Rape survivor, her mother and grandfather hand on June 3 met Union minister Harsimrat Kaur Badal, who held a hurriedly convened press conference along with them. But then neither the girl nor the family members had spoken about her father selling her, instead they had accused the police and some Congress leaders of harassing them. BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Plan in place to develop Amritsar into s.description: AMRITSAR: People visiting Heritage Street in the vicinity of Golden Temple will soon have access to free high speed Wi-Fi network — a move along with other initiatives including setting up of reverse vending machines, sanitary napkin vending machines and incinerators — to make Amritsar a smart city. While talking to TOI on Wednesday, CEO, Amritsar Smart City Ltd, Komal Mittal, informed that free Wi-Fi service would begin within next three to four months. “The contract could be awarded in another ten days and then within three months it should be operational,” she said. Giving technical details, Amritsar distributor of Netplus Broadband Services Pvt. Ltd, Sukhamrit Singh, informed that anyone in the Heritage Street could browse free internet at the speed of 4Mbps for first one hour. “We will be setting up around 20 access points in different locations across the Heritage Street for better and seamless connectivity,” said Sukhamrit. “The moment a person enters the Heritage Street, he will get a message of free Wi Fi service access,” he added. Komal informed that they were in a process to procure around 60 sanitary napkins vending machines and 85 incinerators. “These machines will be placed at all government senior secondary schools of the city, some officials buildings and public toilets,” she informed. The sanitary pads would be sold at a nominal cost of around Rs 2 to 5 and a national tender had been floated for the supply of sanitary pads, she informed. “We aim to improve the menstrual hygiene of girls and scientific disposal of the sanitary pads,” she said. To prevent plastic bottles and tin cans going into sewerage, as many as 40 reverse vending machines will be installed at various places in the city . “People can dump bottles or tin cans in the machines and their crushed material can be used for recycling,” said the CEO. She further informed that vendors would tie-up with local shopkeepers or food chains to issue food coupons. “This will be done to encourage people to dispose off pet bottles and tin cans at an appropriate place and to keep the city clean.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Kotkapura firing: Bail plea of then DSP.description: BATHINDA: Faridkot additional district and sessions court judge Harbans Singh Lekhi rejected the anticipatory bail application of superintendent of police Baljit Singh on Thursday. The court had heard arguments on the bail application in Kotkapura police firing case on Wednesday and reserved the verdict for Thursday. Earlier, on June 6, district and sessions judge Harpal Singh had rejected the anticipatory bail of then Kotkapura SHO Gurdeep Singh Pandher but accepted the anticipatory bail of ADCP Paramjit Singh Pannu in the same case. The special investigations team (SIT) had on May 28 filed the chargesheet in Kotkapura police firing case in the court against five policemen and ex-MLA Mantar Singh Brar. The chargesheet under various charges, including attempt to murder, had been filed against then commissioner of police Ludhiana Paramraj Singh Umranangal, ex-SSP Charanjit Singh Sharma, then ADCP Ludhiana Paramjit Singh Pannu, then DSP Kotkapura Baljit Singh, then SHO Kotkapura Gurdeep Singh Pandher and Brar. Umranangal and Charanjit Sharma are out on bail. The regular case will come up for hearing on June 15 as the court of judicial magistrate Ist class(JMIC)Ekta Uppal has directed all the five cops to appear before court. Unruly scenes mark Operation Bluestar an.description: AMRITSAR: The 35th anniversary of Operation Bluestar was observed amidst protests and sloganeering by pro-Khalistan groups who brandished swords and scuffled with lathi-wielding task force of the Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) and policemen in civvies in Darbar Sahib complex here on Thursday. The hardliners did not pay heed to the Akal Takht’s directions to Sikh individuals and bodies to not indulge in any kind of hooliganism or create ruckus in Darbar Sahib complex on the day when all would be remembering and paying homage to the persons who were killed in the Army action aimed at flushing out armed militants from the Golden Temple complex in 1984. Groups brandish swords inside the Golden Temple complex on ThursdayThousands of devotees early in the morning thronged the Akal Takht to attend the ‘bhog’ ceremony of religious prayers that began on June 4. Security agencies were put on high alert in and around this city in viewo f the anniversary. A day ahead of the anniversary, the Akal Takht acting jathedar said Parliament shoulda ccept that the attack carried out on the directions of the Indian government was a blunder and should submit an official apology for it. “The Indian Parliament should bring ‘maafi da matta’ (an apology resolution) for the execution of Ghallughara (Operation Bluestar) in 1984,” he said in a statement. As against previous years, the SGPC tactfully restricted the Khalistani exponent Simranjit Singh Mann to a corner from where he delivered his speech exhorting Sikhs to struggle for Khalistan. Other pro-Khalistani groups, largely made up of adolescents, kept on raising slogans and struggling with task force to reach close to the Akal Takht. And in the melee, turbans of few were tossed while a few tried to jump over the barricades, and failed to do so, simply uprooted the blockades laid by SGPC. As a group of radicalised youth tried to overpower the SGPC’s human chain barrier, a couple of task force members already equipped with bundle of lathis distributed these among other members of task force to deal with the situation. The situation also turned tense when parallel acting jathedar of Akal Takht Dhian Singh Mand not allowed to deliver his message intially. However, many police personnels in plain clothes were seen pacifying the agitated Sikh radicals. Later, Mand’s supporters distributed his message among mediapersons. Similarly, another group read out the message of parallel jathedar of Akal Takht Jagtar Singh Hawara, assassin of former Punjab chief minister Beant Singh who is lodged in Tihar jail at present. Many Khalistani elements were carrying posters having pictures of militant leader Jarnail Singh Bhinderanwala and were wearing T shirts with his photographs and AK-47 rifles. Muktsar woman assault: Day on, CM says w.description: BATHINDA: A day after a woman was mercilessly assaulted by the brother and aides of a Congress councillor in Muktsar, Punjab chief minister Amarinder Singh on Saturday asked police to go tough in the case, even as the local politician continued to be on the run. In a tweet, Amarinder wrote that no one was above the law and such acts of violence would not be tolerated. Acting on the incident, Muktsar police had on Friday booked municipal council councillor Rakesh Chaudhary for criminal conspiracy, and arrested his brothers Suresh and Sunny Chaudhary and four others for attempt to murder. Rakesh Chaudhary is yet to be arrested. Punjab State Commission for Women member Kiranpreet Kaur Dhami, and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLAs Aman Arora and Kultar Singh Sandhwan, also visited the woman at the civil hospital in Muktsar. Meanwhile, as the video continued to spread online, it came under criticism from several people on social media too. Meena Rani (33) was dragged out of her home and assaulted with kicks, punches and a leather belt on the road in front of her house on Friday. Two videos of the incident had gone viral soon after the incident. The assaulters did not soften their blows even as Rani’s 11-year-old son was crying. By the end of the video, the accused were also seen assaulting Meena’s mother Mansi Rani, when she tried to save the victim. Meena owed Rs 23,000 to Suresh Chaudhary. When she sought more time for the repayment, the accused assaulted her, it has been alleged. Arora and Sandhwan said the councillor’s family had a criminal background. “Despite this, the Congress admitted him in the party. We will raise the matter in the state assembly,” said Arora. Muktsar SSP Manjit Singh Dhesi said they were trying to arrest the councillor and his three relatives who have also been charged with criminal conspiracy in the case — Rakesh Chaudhary’s wife Jyoti, Sunny’s wife Renu and son Hassan. In all, there are 10 accused in the case. Six of them — Suresh, Sunny, and their accomplices Roop Lal, Guddi, Sekhu and Jebo — have been arrested. These six are charged with attempt to murder. Police said they had gone to the house of the accused, but they were not present there. Meanwhile, the six arrested accused were produced before a court on Saturday and remanded in judicial custody. Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

\u2018Don\u2019t call it Sweepers\u2019.description: AMRITSAR: Punjabis living in Shillong have asked the Meghalaya government to change the name of their locality from Sweepers’ Colony to Punjabi Lane. They have also urged chief minister Conrad Sangma to convene a meeting of all stakeholders to ensure peace in the area. Shillong City Gurdwara Management Committee president Gurjit Singh described the colony’s name as derogatory. “Even the National Human Rights Commission has directed the government to change the name. Not only politicians, unfortunately, even a section of the media calls it Sweepers’ Colony,” added Gurjit, who is the secretary of Harijan Panchayat Committee in Shillong. Punjab: Farmers sceptical of 8-hour unin.description: AMRITSAR/GURDASPUR: Farmers in Punjab are sceptical of regular power supply during paddy sowing season even as the state government has announced to provide 8 hours of uninterrupted power supply to them. TOI on Thursday talked to a section of farmers in Amritsar and Gurdaspur districts who hailed the government’s announcement but at the same time they were apprehensive over its implementation and were of view that the assurances would go haywire during peak load hours. Notably, paddy sowing has begun in Punjab from Thursday after chief minister Captain Amarinder Singh advanced the date of paddy sowing to June 13 from earlier June 20. “There was no electricity problem on the first day, we are happy, but the condition may not remain the same in tje coming days,” Lakhbir Singh, a farmer from Nizampur village said. He also expressed concern over shortage of power transformers which, he said, could be a major problem in days to come. Sukhwinder Singh, another farmer from Fatehghar Churina in Gurdaspur district said: “There wasn’t any electricity issue except occasional tripping but I wish government keeps its promise this time.” Rattan Singh Randhwa, a farmer leader, said: “We received several complaints of power tripping on the very first day of paddy sowing from various parts of Majah.” He also claimed incidents of power theft in connivance with some of the employees of the electricity department. “But we are of view that the system will collapse during peak load and government will not be able to fulfill its assurance of 8 hours of uninterrupted electricity supply to agriculture sector,” Randhwa said. Rubbishing all apprehensions, PSPCL chief engineer (border range) Sandeep Kumar claimed that the department had taken all the preventive maintenance measures to ensure 8 hours of uninterrupted electricity supply to farmers and round the clock power supply for domestic usages. “All the loose wires have been tightened, overloaded feeders have been de-loaded and we have made arrangements to replace any defected transformer within 48 hours” said Sandeep. PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Here is a list of contituencies with prominent candiadates or clashes.    SEATS CHIEF CANDIDATES   Sivaganga H Raja (BJP); Karti Chidambaram (Congress)   Chennai South Jayavardhan Jayakumar (AIADMK); Tamizhachi Thangapandian (DMK)   Chennai North R Mohanraj (DMDK); Kalanidhi Veerasami (DMK)   Chennai Central Sam Paul (PMK); Dayanidhi Maran (DMK)   Chidambaram(SC) P Chandrasekar (AIADMK);    Coimbatore CP Radhakrishnan (BJP)   Cuddalore R Govindasamy (PMK); T.R.P.S. No accused cop turns up, Kotkapura firin.description: BATHINDA: The court of Faridkot judicial magistrate Ist class Ekta Uppal adjourned the Kotkapura firing case to June 15, after none of the five cops, who are accused in the case, appeared before it on Monday. Then police commissioner, Ludhiana, Paramraj Singh Umranangal, and former SSP Charanjit Singh Sharma did not appear before the court on medical grounds while three other cops — then ADCP Ludhiana Paramjit Singh Pannu, then DSP and now SP Baljit Singh and then Kotkapura SHO Gurdeep Singh Pandher — too failed to make the court appearance. Meanwhile, arguments could not take place in the court of additional district and session judge Harbans Singh Neki on the anticipatory bail application of then DSP Baljit Singh and the matter was adjourned to June 12. The court, on June 6, had accepted the anticipatory bail of Pannu but rejected the anticipatory bail of Pandher. The special investigations team (SIT) had on May 28 filed the chargesheet in Kotkapura police firing case in court against five policemen and ex-MLA Mantar Singh Brar. The charges, including attempt to murder, had been filed against then Ludhiana police commissioner Umranangal, ex-SSP Sharma, Pannu, Baljit Singh, Pandher and Brar. The role of ex-chief minister Parkash Singh Badal, ex-deputy chief minister Sukhbir Badal, ex-DGP Sumedh Singh Saini and then DIG Amar Singh Chahal is also being investigated in the case. After the Bargari sacrilege incident on October 12, 2015 protesters had assembled at an intersection in Kotkapura on October 13 and police had resorted to lathicharge, use of water canons and tear gas shells on protesters in the wee hours of October 14. Cops had even fired bullets. Many protesters had sustained injuries, including one Ajit Singh who took a bullet in the leg. According to the chargesheet, Umranagal had called the then SSP and the ADCP to Kotkapura. Earlier, SAD had accused SIT member IG Kunwar Vijay Pratap Singh of continuing to work in the SIT despite orders by the Election Commission to spare him (from SIT) till the code of conduct for parliamentary elections was in place. SAD had accused the IG of signing the chargesheet on May 23, days before the code of conduct was lifted on May 26. In a Facebook post on June 7, IG Kunwar Vijay Pratap Singh had termed the chargesheet “of international standard, not very common in India. We can see such charge-sheets in the USA and UK and in some cases in France and Germany also”. Faridkot district attorney Rajneesh Goyal said the hearing on chargesheet was adjourned as Umranangal and Charanjit Sharma had sent medical certificates to explain their inability to appear before the court.
